events.name: Brittney Griner Released in Prisoner Swap with Russian Arms Dealer Viktor Bout
events.wd_label: Brittney Griner Released in Prisoner Swap with Russian Arms Dealer Viktor Bout
events.wd_description: WNBA player Brittney Griner was released as part of a prisoner swap between the US and Russia, involving the exchange of Griner for Russian arms dealer Viktor Bout.
events.description: WNBA player Brittney Griner was released as part of a prisoner swap between the US and Russia, involving the exchange of Griner for Russian arms dealer Viktor Bout.

events.name: Griner's Detention and Release
events.wd_description: Brittney Griner was detained in Russia in February on drug smuggling charges and sentenced to nine years in prison before being released in a prisoner swap in December.
events.description: Brittney Griner was detained in Russia in February on drug smuggling charges and sentenced to nine years in prison before being released in a prisoner swap in December.

events.name: Viktor Bout's Release
events.wd_description: Viktor Bout, a Russian arms dealer known as the "Merchant of Death," was released from a US prison as part of the prisoner swap, where he was serving a 25-year sentence for serious crimes.
events.description: Viktor Bout, a Russian arms dealer known as the "Merchant of Death," was released from a US prison as part of the prisoner swap, where he was serving a 25-year sentence for serious crimes.

events.name: Diplomatic Tensions and Negotiations
events.wd_description: Griner's detention and subsequent release amid the Ukraine war led to significant diplomatic tensions between the US and Russia, with negotiations continuing despite the broader conflict.
events.description: Griner's detention and subsequent release amid the Ukraine war led to significant diplomatic tensions between the US and Russia, with negotiations continuing despite the broader conflict.

events.name: Putin Signs Law to Mobilize Convicted Criminals for Military Service
events.wd_label: Putin Signs Law to Mobilize Convicted Criminals for Military Service
events.wd_description: Russian President Vladimir Putin signed a law allowing the conscription of citizens with serious criminal convictions to be mobilized for military service, potentially increasing the number of mobilized soldiers in the war in Ukraine.
events.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin signed a law allowing the conscription of citizens with serious criminal convictions to be mobilized for military service, potentially increasing the number of mobilized soldiers in the war in Ukraine.

events.name: New Mobilization Law
events.wd_description: The law signed by Putin allows citizens with convictions for serious crimes, including murder and drug trafficking, to be conscripted for military service, enabling the mobilization of hundreds of thousands of people.
events.description: The law signed by Putin allows citizens with convictions for serious crimes, including murder and drug trafficking, to be conscripted for military service, enabling the mobilization of hundreds of thousands of people.

events.name: Increased Mobilization Numbers
events.wd_description: Putin announced that an additional 18,000 soldiers had already been mobilized, exceeding the initial target of 300,000, with conscriptions now including those with serious criminal records.
events.description: Putin announced that an additional 18,000 soldiers had already been mobilized, exceeding the initial target of 300,000, with conscriptions now including those with serious criminal records.

events.name: Partial Mobilization Continuation
events.wd_description: Despite earlier announcements of the suspension of partial mobilization, Putin's partial mobilization order remains in effect until he signs an official decree to end it.
events.description: Despite earlier announcements of the suspension of partial mobilization, Putin's partial mobilization order remains in effect until he signs an official decree to end it.

events.name: Heatwaves in Western Europe Lead to Over 20,000 Deaths
events.wd_label: Heatwaves in Western Europe Lead to Over 20,000 Deaths
events.wd_description: The summer heatwaves of 2022 in Western Europe resulted in over 20,000 excess deaths, as temperatures reached record highs in several regions, according to analysis.
events.description: The summer heatwaves of 2022 in Western Europe resulted in over 20,000 excess deaths, as temperatures reached record highs in several regions, according to analysis.

events.name: Record Heatwaves in Western Europe
events.wd_description: During the summer of 2022, Western Europe experienced unprecedented heatwaves, with temperatures reaching record highs, including 40°C in London and 44°C in parts of Spain.
events.description: During the summer of 2022, Western Europe experienced unprecedented heatwaves, with temperatures reaching record highs, including 40°C in London and 44°C in parts of Spain.

events.name: Excess Mortality Analysis
events.wd_description: An analysis estimated that over 20,000 excess deaths occurred during the summer heatwaves, with a higher mortality rate observed on heat-period days compared to non-heat-period days.
events.description: An analysis estimated that over 20,000 excess deaths occurred during the summer heatwaves, with a higher mortality rate observed on heat-period days compared to non-heat-period days.

events.name: Expert Commentary on Future Heatwaves
events.wd_description: Dr. Eunice Lo, a climate change and health research fellow, stated that heatwaves are becoming more frequent and intense due to global warming, predicting more extreme heatwaves in the future.
events.description: Dr. Eunice Lo, a climate change and health research fellow, stated that heatwaves are becoming more frequent and intense due to global warming, predicting more extreme heatwaves in the future.

events.name: GM's Efforts to Secure Battery Materials for EV Production
events.wd_label: GM's Efforts to Secure Battery Materials for EV Production
events.wd_description: General Motors is securing materials needed to support its plans for battery-electric vehicles by building a North American supply chain and partnering with companies like Vale and Microvast.
events.description: General Motors is securing materials needed to support its plans for battery-electric vehicles by building a North American supply chain and partnering with companies like Vale and Microvast.

events.name: Agreement with Vale for Nickel Sulfate
events.wd_label: Agreement with Vale for Nickel Sulfate
events.wd_description: GM has reached an agreement with Vale S.A. for the long-term supply of battery-grade nickel sulfate from Vale's proposed plant in Bécancour, Québec, to support its BEV production needs.
events.description: GM has reached an agreement with Vale S.A. for the long-term supply of battery-grade nickel sulfate from Vale's proposed plant in Bécancour, Québec, to support its BEV production needs.

events.name: Collaboration with Microvast
events.wd_description: GM and Microvast are developing specialized battery separator technology and building a new separator plant in the U.S., supported by a $200 million grant from the U.S. Department of Energy.
events.description: GM and Microvast are developing specialized battery separator technology and building a new separator plant in the U.S., supported by a $200 million grant from the U.S. Department of Energy.

events.name: Participation in Battery500 Consortium
events.wd_description: GM is participating in the Battery500 Consortium, which is awarded $75 million for research on developing more reliable, affordable, longer-range, and higher-performance batteries.
events.description: GM is participating in the Battery500 Consortium, which is awarded $75 million for research on developing more reliable, affordable, longer-range, and higher-performance batteries.
